column5: Every time I go to Canada I get a skin irritation along each side of my nose, does anybody know what causes this or what you can do about it? I think I had heard once that it could be from the pine trees, any information would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Muskrat
Maybe your getting to close to them "peelers".

The air in Canada is pretty dry compared to more southerly regions. Maybe you are getting a case of dry skin? I usually have to use almost a whole tube of Chap Stick to keep my lips from cracking during the week there. I'm heading up to the Minaki area on Friday. Hope the weather and the fishing warms up! IPS

If you're going in late May to early June, the pine trees are pollentaing and it can make quite a show if the wind blows good. Like a yellow snow storm barreling down on you. I've often counted my blessings that I wasn't allergic to pine tree pollen. I do get dry hands up north, but it is from using the river water to wash off fish slime then using my pant leg to dry my hands...
it may very well be sunburn from sunlight relected off the lake. phish
